content.raw:
this wording make it sound like this convention is required, but the following paragraph indicates that is not the case

Perhaps reword as:

"This *would mean* only the `<sdf>` tag in an
SDFormat file ~~file~~ may have the `xmlns:` attribute."
content.html:
this wording make it sound like this convention is required, but the following paragraph indicates that is not the case

Perhaps reword as:

"This would mean only the <sdf> tag in an SDFormat file file may have the xmlns: attribute."

pullrequest.title: Proposal for custom elements and attributes

content.raw:
BTW, I had

> This means only the `<sdf>` tag in an
SDFormat world file or the topmost `<model>` tag in an SDFormat model file may
have the `xmlns:` attribute.

but I realized that even model files have `<sdf>` as their root tag so I changed it to say

> This means only the `<sdf>` tag in an
SDFormat file file may have the `xmlns:` attribute.
content.html:
BTW, I had

This means only the <sdf> tag in an SDFormat world file or the topmost <model> tag in an SDFormat model file may have the xmlns: attribute.

but I realized that even model files have <sdf> as their root tag so I changed it to say

This means only the <sdf> tag in an SDFormat file file may have the xmlns: attribute.

content.raw: Yes, I think the goal is, eventually, to use custom elements and tags for Gazebo-specific parameters. I like the idea of the Extension Registry. Thanks for pointing it out.
content.html: Yes, I think the goal is, eventually, to use custom elements and tags for Gazebo-specific parameters. I like the idea of the Extension Registry. Thanks for pointing it out.

pull_request.title: Proposal for custom elements and attributes

pullrequest.title: Proposal for custom elements and attributes

content.raw: Thanks a lot for working on this, this would be really helpful for parsing `sdf` files from non-Gazebo software. It would be great if it could be progressively used also for the most Gazebo-specific parts of SDF, see  [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/93/change-the-sdf-spec-to-make-less-gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/93/change-the-sdf-spec-to-make-less-gazebo) . Once the proposal get merged and implemented, it probably could make sense to keep an “Extension Registry”, i.e.  a documentation page linking public available extensions, something like the [glTF Extension Registry](https://github.com/KhronosGroup/glTF/tree/master/extensions) or the [COLLADA Extension Registry](https://www.khronos.org/collada/wiki/How_to_create_a_COLLADA_Extension#Extension_Registry).
content.html: Thanks a lot for working on this, this would be really helpful for parsing sdf files from non-Gazebo software. It would be great if it could be progressively used also for the most Gazebo-specific parts of SDF, see https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/93/change-the-sdf-spec-to-make-less-gazebo . Once the proposal get merged and implemented, it probably could make sense to keep an “Extension Registry”, i.e. a documentation page linking public available extensions, something like the glTF Extension Registry or the COLLADA Extension Registry.
